elements.title: Pep (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pep (pictured) was falsely accused of murdering a cat and sent to Eastern State Penitentiary?

elements.title: color-changing cats (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that color-changing cats could help us communicate with the future?

elements.title: charm quark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the charm quark made physicists eat hats?

elements.title: ur mum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that ur mum has an eleven-second scream?

elements.title: Lianxing Temple (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the White Dagoba at Lianxing Temple was probably not originally made of an enormous pile of salt?

elements.title: the worst joke in legal history (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that no one laughed at the worst joke in legal history?

elements.title: her obsession (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Olivia Rodrigo spilled her guts, her obsession came out?

elements.title: stuffing cookies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that you could be sentenced to serve time in prison for stuffing cookies?

elements.title: a blizzard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a blizzard helped end the Cold War?

elements.title: Colin MacKay (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Colin Mackay, the political editor at Scottish Television, was "very sad" when Colin MacKay, the political editor at Scottish Television, died?
